bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to the Hotel Patton, [19--]

div1.p: Carter writes in order to make a reservation for an upcoming meeting.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to the Hotel Patton, [19--]
div1.opener:
2121 California St., N. W.
, D. C.
/LC
Hotel Patton,
Chatanooga, Tenn.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
Your letter, asking if I wished a room reserved for the next
meeting of the Southern Medical, received.

I would say that the terms are not entirely clear. If I am
to pay $8.00 a day for a room, naturally, I do not want one. If
by occupying a room with another man or two men--separate beds--
the rate is from $2.00 to $4.00 for each one, I will be glad to
make a reservation.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. R. Carter,
Secretary. Per
Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
